name: fsl-siena-sienax
label: fsl-siena-sienax
description: FSL's SIENA. As implemented in this Gear SIENA allows for basic extraction of 14 subcortical regions and Brain-Stem/4th Ventricle. This gear either takes in a deskulled high resolution T1 image or a T1 image with a skull where the user has to specify the T1 to be deskulled. In the latter option, brain extraction BET2 will be used.

nifti_1.description: Structural T1 NIfTI file to be processed.

nifti_2.description: Structural T1 NIfTI file to be processed.

BOTTOM.description: ignore from b (mm) upwards in MNI152/Talairach space [default=false]

REGIONAL.description: tell SIENAX to estimate "regional" volumes as well as global; this produces peripheral cortex GM volume (3-class segmentation only) and ventricular CSF volume [default=false]

SEG.description: two-class segmentation (don't segment grey and white matter separately) - use this if there is poor grey/white contrast [default=false]

SS_BET.description: use standard-space masking as well as BET [default=false]

S_FAST.description: if you want to change the segmentation defaults, put FAST options inside double-quotes after using the -S flag. For example, to increase the number of segmentation iterations use: -S "-i 20"

T2.description: tell FAST that the input images are T2-weighted and not T1 [default=false]

TOP.description: ignore from t (mm) upwards in MNI152/Talairach space [default=false]

siena_single_input.description: Run Siena with a single input. Default behavior for single input is to run SienaX.

author: Kaleb Fischer
